alert.note: Alert for Western Siskiyou County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 06 at 3:40AM PST until March 08 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST THIS MORNING ABOVE 1000 FEET... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM TUESDAY TO 10 AM PST WEDNESDAY ABOVE 1500 FEET... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning above 1500 feet, heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to an inch. * WHERE...Western Siskiyou County. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, from 4 AM Tuesday to 10 AM PST Wednesday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 10 AM PST this morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is likely and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now.
